title: Derivative of an inverse function from a table

content.question: The table above gives values of the differentiable functions f and g, and <math> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> </math>, the derivative of f, at selected values of x. If <math> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math>, what is the value of <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> </math> ?

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
